reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun game to play with friends, but with a twist a challange to it.
When you start off you start outside of a portal in the middle of nowhere with your friends or just random people you decided to join. You have a bit until night to at least get a fire started so you don't get attacked by the shadows lurking in the dark, and if you're out there you are most likely going to die. Dying will cause your friends trouble, they start to lose their sanity from one of the others who are stranded there die and it haunts them. No fear though, you can easily craft yourself a TellTale Heart. You go up to your friend who has turned into a ghost and stick a new heart into them giving them life again, or you can go haunt a touch stone which will also bring you back to life. Be careful though (I think) it chips away at your max health (last time I played with my friend I had to revive them quite a bit and their max health was lowered).
On the other hand the game play is great the graphics are simple and great, plus you don't have to unlock the characters. You can get more fanmade characters off the DST website or the steam workshop which is also fun, but the one issue with it is when this happened (to me). When my friend who downloaded the same mods, but off the steam store (when I got it off the official DST website) would not work. So when you want to play with mods make sure you download the content off the same website/workshop.
Again this is a great game for people who enjoy survival co-op games.

reviewText:
Product received for free

So my best friend gifted me this game out of the kindness of her heart, and boy was i excited to get to play this game~~! After being nearly 100 hours in this game i thought its best that i give it a review, so here it is! This is what a true survival game is all about - this is THE game that got me into this genre in the first place. I will say the game had a few minior annoying problems in the vanilla version; no way to find your team mates on the map if you go your own way finding resources, and a little hard to find food or other stuff you may  need in default settings of the map sometimes.

But these can be easily fixed with workshop mods so theres really nothing bad to say about this game. To me this was a very refreshing and new game from the useal BOOM BOOM KILL EM' ALL types of games that i useally play. No zombies, gore, medieval stuff, dragons, nudity, or guns - just pure adventure fighting to stay alive. in real life i wouldnt last 1 day in the world of Dont starve togther...id miss my internet and stuffed crust pizza too much :3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't Starve Together is exactly what I imagined playing Don't Starve with friends to be like.
Burning down forests, together.
Dying, together.
Shaving Beefalo, together.
Starving, together.
Dying again trying to get your loot back, together.
Killing spiders, together.
Fishing, together.
Surviving the cold, alone because your friend died.
Eating rotten food, together.
Doing science, together.
Cooking meatballs, together.
Dying in a stupid way and leaving the game for a week before coming back to play again, together.

Obviously this game is in early development, but even now it's super fun to play, and I definitley recommend you buy it. Or you can always wait until it comes out of early access...

reviewText:
Hey guys, here's a quick review ( and pardon my english ) :

Good graphics, runs very smoothly even on my regular laptop , and most of all its a hardcore survival and unforgiving game.
I have been playing most of the time in public servers. And one thing i dont understand is, why people put the server public if they kick u away immediately when entered the server. So, that's why  i recommend that u play on dedicated servers if you're on public.

Some of the Beginner tips :

Character matters ( Most of the characters are balanced which means, they have a positive talent/skill but also have a negative one. For example Wolfgang can become strong which grants you increase attack and health when your stomach is full. However if u dont eat enough you will become weak. Check the game's Wiki to know more about characters. Also choose wisely your character when u enter a server/ or host. You can't change it anymore in-game. You just have to wait until all dies and reset the server ( Survival mode ).

Seasons ( I Wouldn't join a game which is on early winter, you'll freeze in no time if there isn't any ppl around and also refuse to communicate, lol, Winter starts at day 20 ).

Resources ( Gather anything in sight, twigs, grass, flowers, carrot, flint.. then make a axe and chop down trees and don't forget to mine some gold to progress, which can be indentified by the veins in the rocks.
And cut down those birch trees which are white and have some black stripes on it, then u can sometimes get birchnut to be cooked and eat.)

Sanity ( Picking flowers raises your sanity, eatin cooked food etc. etc. or make a flower ''hat'' with 12 flower pedals to maintain your sanity. )

Well, that's some of the tips i got through with my 10 h gameplay and experience, guess you have to find out the rest yourself.

Oh, do i recommend this game ? Yes i absolutely recommend this game and HIGHLY recommend that you play with friend(s). Most of all, don't die and Don't Starve Together.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't Starve is one of my favourite games and I can confirm that it's significantly better with a friend. Trying to survive feels more meaningful when someone is depending on you, and you're depending on them. You split your resources and cooperate to stay alive, and lack of cooperation ends abruptly with death. You'll end up learning new strategies and things about the game from the other person and everything feels much less lonely. This version of the game is also a great learning tool for those who are new to Don't Starve as you can have another person directly guide you through it. I recommend playing Don't Starve Together wholeheartedly, it's an amazing experience. I can't wait till development is finished and my favourite lumberjack gets added!

Edit: He's been added. Feels good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm not really a fan of survival games usually, but DST is a very approachable game - especially with friends. The world customization allows for some nice variants if you want to make things a little easier or harder as well.

The art style is rather cute, and it is simple enough to learn the basic crafting. But strategy for the long term and advanced crafting take time to understand. The mod base is growing and includes lots of interesting and useful UI, character, and environment additions.

I really wasn't interested in the original Don't Starve, but playing through the DST craziness with friends is quite a fun experience!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is addictive. Halp.
Day 235: Killed by werepigs. GG.

For an early access game, Don't Starve Together (DST) is well put together by the developers. The game mechanics are simple and easy for players to get into and the concept - being able to survive (together) for as long as possible within the randomly generated world - is simple. Unlike Dont Starve, utilising the resources given  is not the only challenge in DST. The main challenge, I believe, is cooperation between the players in order to survive. Without this cooperation, survival is less likely to be achieved. On the other hand, like Don't Starve (DS), the basics of the original game are integrated into DST. Game controls and the characters from DS are all integrated into DST aside from the Reign of Giants DLC. Hopefully Reign of Giants will be integrated into multiplayer soon.

As I continue to play DST, I will continue to edit my posts and note down the glitches that I have come across as well as suggestions that may improve the game in the future. Feel free to leave comments regarding this.

GLITCHES:
• Every time a dapper vest is dropped, the vest cannot be picked up. (FIXED)
• Items that have been dropped near drying racks are sometimes extremely difficult for the player to pick up.

SUGGESTIONS:
• Being able to name chests would help a lot when sorting out resources.
• Ability to build rooves for houses/structures.
• Mini maps - could be a craftable item so that players have the choice whether to have it on their screen or not.
• Waypoints.
• Buildable teleporters.

EDIT:
- The recent changes on Willow, though it's a stopgap, is ridiculous. The trademark of Willow being the much-loved firestarter has been lost.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One day I launched Don't Starve and played , but one night I asked myself that question : Will I ever meet other people ?
Well Hell God Damn Way I can ! Don't Starve Together is an amazing experience and what missed to the initial game .
Server supports mods , gameplay still as good , although you might get a good connection if you want to play without some lag .

Don't Starve Together is almost a full game wich for a Beta is pretty full compared to others (I'm looking at you DayZ) .
The game is the same as the single player mode , but this time , no more of running around the firepit 'cause you're bored ,  your friends are here to entertain and if they want to survive too , they better help .

I highly recommend the expansion , even if it's 5 dollars (or Euros or whatever the money of your country) , it will be worth trust me !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't Starve Together contains the highly requested feature of multiplayer to Don't Starve. On June 3, 2015, Don't Starve Together was released for free to owners of Don't Starve on Steam. For those who are not, Don't Starve and Don't Starve Together can be bought individually or as a bundle. It was originally scheduled to come out in Summer 2014.

Starting December 15, 2014, Don't Starve Together Beta was in Steam Early Access, which closed when the game was released just under 6 months later.

--Features--
Don't Starve Together has multiple ways to play with others: local, network, and matchmaking play. Many items have been balanced or removed in order to keep the game fair. Game mode and PvP are optional by the server operator. Dedicated, player-hosted and LAN servers are available, and chat is global or local depending on the server admin's preference. A type of server called Friends Only" allows a server to be created whereby the only people who can join have to be on your steam friends list. Many console commands have changed or been removed for DST.

--Game modes--
There are three game modes
date: with additional modes that can be added by mods. Survival is the default mode
voteText: in which dead players become ghosts that drain the sanity of living players by 3.3/min (up to 10/min total). When all players are dead in Survival
helpfulPercent: a timer starts
votesHelpful: and if no players are revived in that time
votesTotal: the world is reset. Endless mode is intended to be a more relaxed mode that doesn't force players to cooperate. In Endless
votesFunny: the world never resets
commentsCount: and players may resurrect themselves at the spawn portal. Wilderness is intended to be more like other survival games. Players spawn in random locations across the map
column17: and players who die are returned to character select wiping their map and respawning them in a new random location. No resurrection items exist
column18: including touchstones (although their set pieces with pig heads will still be generated).\n\nRate: 10/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A classic game made into multiplayer. What's not to love?
The excitement, the memories and more can now be shared with your friends, enemies or strangers.

To anyone thinking on getting it and playing with a friend, here are some tips to help you out.
-Birchnut trees are a quick and safe way of getting food. Make sure to cut the trees with two branches at the top.
-Be careful on what character you choose as they all have flaws but the best to start with is Wilson.
-Always have some extra food on you. You'll never know when someone desperatly needs food.
-Green Mushrooms are very good if you are low on sanity. Make sure too cook them though!
-The best area to put a base in is near Beefalo  and a road for quick travel.
-You do not have to fight spiders to get their silk/glands. Simply lure them into a trap and you get the resources trouble free!
-Another say way of getting meat is by going near Moles, putting rocks/flint on the floor and waiting til they go out. Then attack them and you get a morsel without risk!
-Treeguards can be be calmed by planting saplings of their trees near them.
-Be careful when choosing Webber, as pigs will attack you on sight and you have lower sanity.

That's all i can think off the top of my head. Happy hunting and as always; Don't Starve (Together)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\n(Coming from someone who has never played the original but has seen a lot of footage of it)  I got gifted Don't Starve Together yesterday, and while I have only played 4 hours, it's been really fun. You could say the game was made easier, but it wasn't in some cases, if you are new to playing Don't Starve, losing your friend can be one of the most traumatic experiences in games. The selection of characters can make a game interesting, trying to find out the gimmicks of them and such. The sound of the game can really make you feel creeped out, the pig screams and tallbirds made the game very creepy, and adds to the atmosphere. Overall, it's just as spine chilling as the original, but much more fun due to having a friend/s alongside you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've got almost 1500 hours in this game while writing this review, so I have some experience and can share my thoughts about current Don't Starve Together.

The bad:
- Rubberbanding. Having 40 ping in this game renders it unplayable. It's the biggest thing that makes it more of a chore than fun.
You can disable it with a console command, though.
Because of that you get godawful controls, mind you, but that's still better than game lying in your face about where you currently are.

- Summer. There's 4 seasons in this game, and if you're playing on standard settings, the Summer comes last. There's not much to do during that season. If you host a server with caves, good for you - go spelunking. If you don't have caves, then, well... Prepare to get bored and annoyed.

- Public servers. There's almost no reason to go and play with random people on the public servers. Why? Because anybody can join. And that means little Timmy who will die repeatedly and haunt everything out of spite will make this game infuriating for you. Or a sad, basement-dwelling troll Olaf from Russia who will come with his butt-buddy and burn your base down.


The good:
- It's Don't Starve: Reign of Giants with improved mechanics and new content, made multiplayer. There's a lot of stuff to learn and to discover. This game can bring you hundreds of hours of enjoyment before it gets stale.

- Workshop support. There's only so much developers can do. What if I wanted to play as some dumb cartoon character with wacky weapons? What if I wanted the game to tell me how much damage my weapon does?
Workshop is the answer. There's so many great mods out there that will alter or better your experience in some way.

Overall, if you consider buying this game to play with your friend/loved one, go for it. It's a pretty good survival game. Still, it's a roguelike (but way more forgiving than the original), so watch out, because everything wants to kill you. And you'll need to kill to eat. Don't starve, and have fun.

reviewText:
It's Don't Starve with co-op. Every pro and con I have with the single player applies here, and it's wonderful now that I can play with my pals.

You can download mods to improve the HUD, make the game easier/harder, and even download custom characters such as your lovely waifu.

I once entered a game and needed some charcoal, and proceeded to burn down the carefully constructed farm of trees my friends had assembled for supplying winter wood. They seemed angry at me for some reason.

You can also set a whole forest on fire. That's pretty swell.

What's not to love?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

========================================

Vince Rowe ReviewsSaving the Industry one Game at a Time!

[YouTube Link]   [Curation Link]

========================================


9/10 - It's Multiplayer Don't Starve.

Basically, if you liked the original Don't Starve then you'll like this a lot. It's essentially the same game bar a few minor changes that up the difficulty slightly but ultimately removes Perma-Death.

Now, I'm going to talk about features specific to Don't Starve Together or else I'll be repeating myself, check out my Don't Starve for this instead.

The main thing it introduces into this game is multiplayer, now Perma-Death doesn't really bode well in multiplayer games because someone's going to end up sitting dead, waiting for his friends to die off one by one. Instead, this game removes the whole idea of Perma-Death from the Don't Starve series, yes, reviving your team-mate is bad for you but still, he doesn't die off 100% and you don't have to restart the game.

With all that being said, it doesn't make the game harder, as an individual you will starve faster, monsters are relatively harder to kill - meaning you'll need to gang up on them - damage and armour has been reduced and it's very difficult to kite mobs now because of the slight lag you'll most likely end up getting. Basically, kiting doesn't work.

The expansion itself doesn't really add in anything new, you get a few new items related to the now present lack of Perma-Death but that's really it. Don't expect this to be a whole new game - it's not. However, it does definitely feel like a whole new game. Unfortunately, a lot is missing from the game at the moment, there's no story mode, or the ability to make a new map. Caves aren't in the game yet, and have no determinate date of when they will actually appear, they did say they will include them in the game. The same applies to Reign of Giants, very few features of Reign of Giants is included and there is no determinate date for when the whole expansion will be included in Don't Starve Together (I also have no idea how they are going to deal with Reign of Giants - being an expansion of an entirely different game). They also say that they will introduce Modding Support - when this finally becomes the case I HIGHLY recommend that you check out a mod called Up and Away" by a Collab of modders (It's basically like Aether was to Minecraft)
date: check it out for the original game as well.\n\nPvP is just terrible... It's like fighting the pigs in the ordinary game if you catch my drift
recommended: it's basically whoever has the best gear wins - "Minecraft PvP". Unless you're a mundane gorm then I'd just avoid the PvP if I were you
hoursPlayed: not to mention that you can just run for ever while Benny Hill plays in the background.\n\nBeing very involved in the Beta of the Vanilla game I can say they Devs seem to be much more distant from the community for Don't Starve Together
voteText: perhaps because they aren't really making a new game now
helpfulPercent: they are just updating it
votesHelpful: but whatever
votesTotal: I thought it was worth mentioning none-the-less.\n\nThat's pretty much all I can really say about Don't Starve Together
votesFunny: like I said
commentsCount:
it's based on the Vanilla version so here I have only spoken about things specific to the Standalone Multiplayer mod. Nothing much has changed really except you can play with others. If you want an in-depth review on the actual Gameplay/Sound/Story/Graphics and all that crap then check out my actual Don't Starve Vanilla review which also contains a section on the Reign of Giants mod.

- Vince

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Are you easily scared? Can you run like hell? Then you might be the right person to survive this madness, cause heroes will find certain death...

This is a hardcore survival exploration game. It has a charming pencil drawn horror comic look, but you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover. You will have to care about hunger, health and sanity.  There's a lot of exploration to do, collecting stuff and crafting items and structures. But beware, almost every creature you meet is a threat and every map section brings new surprises and new dangers. Many strange creatures live in these lands, like the Beefalos or the Moose Goose, the Tallbird and of course the Werepigs. Strange plants like the Living Trees or the Swamp Tentacles are just as dangerous as any creature you could meet. Forget all those creatures and plants, cause the real threat are the seasons. You freeze to death in winter and die of heat in summer. The raining seasons spring and autumn will make you go crazy or you might just be hit by a thunderbolt. You think that's where the developpers stopped? Wrong! They added events to keep you busy, like frog-rain, hound pack attacs, raging giants or meteor showers. You think frog-rain can't be that bad? Well, you clearly haven' met a don't-starve-frog yet. Nasty little bast?!#s. By the way, I hope you love meatballs more than anything, cause you're going to eat a lot of them.

Although still in beta, DST seems to be even better than don't starve single player. What a cute little game, two thumbs up.

reviewText:
This game is very punishing if you have no idea of what to do in order to survive. There's no clear instruction of what to do other than don't die, don't starve, and don't go insane - and there's no tutorial.

Often times you'll wander the wasteland finding nothing but rocks and boulders, praying to the merciful gods that you'll soon reach the sabana where you can finally settle down, living from the hunt and start preparing for Winter. Other times you'll find a good spot fairly soon into the game, only to realize that there's no boulders nearby and you're pretty much stuck because you can't build advance structures.

You WILL die, starve, and go insane multiple times before finally figuring out the do's and don'ts. Once you get past this point, you will finally start having fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3uQsDus53AE

Don’t Starve & Don’t Starve Together: Don’t Starve & its multiplayer component, Don’t Starve Together, is an indie sandbox survival game of the weird & mysterious variety. Developed & published by Klei Entertainment. The gameplay is simple which is pretty common for Klei, the controls are nothing special which isn’t bad, the gameplay itself is mostly fun although I have some personal gripes with combat.

But, first, let’s talk about the graphics, the game is an isometric 2.5D game, with this really intriguing dark pencil drawn art style, the fact that the world of Don’t Starve itself is this mysterious & weird world also lends itself to this type of art style. The music also reminds me of this sort of twisted carnival feel, with lots of weird strings & brass instruments used to set the tone, characters also speak with mashed up music tones from different instruments, sounding mostly unpleasant.

So as it’s about survival, you’ll brave all the elements of the seasons, the ever present drain on your sanity & your belly grumbling. Don’t Starve also features plenty of dangerous creatures as well as some neutral ones ranging from the Pigmen to the aggressive fish like Merms & of course with the Reign of Giants DLC, Giant boss monsters like the Deerclops. It’s a pretty challenging game, don’t expect to survive very long with your first forays into Don’t Starve, you’ll die plenty of times but, never unfairly so, as you learn the game you will become a better survivor & the game rewards you for how long you survive by unlock more characters to play with a total of eleven to choose from all with their own strengths & weaknesses. The story of Don’t Starve is only accessible through the sandbox mode which you start in, if you wish to know how to get there, you’ll have to experiment to find out.

My only real gripe is with the games ‘combat’, you interact with the world mainly with the mouse, you can hold the spacebar to pick up nearby objects which is really handy, you can use the mouse or keyboard to move around, but, when in combat, I only ever was able to use the mouse, this is a problem, since the world is flat it is very easy & common for things to get in the way. This is only exasperated when things are hectic, it’s very annoying when there is multiple enemies. There are several ways to avoid combat, but, when you must it’s a pain dealing with multiple enemies at once. Other than that gripe the game is just pure fun, the multiplayer part was so simple to setup I can’t find anything to complain about, it’s the whole single player game with friends up to six & it’s easy to use plus you get two copies for the one price so it’s pretty cheap.

I personally love Don’t Starve, it was a bit to get into at first, mostly because I was failing a lot at the beginning, but, once I gave it a serious shot I began to get better & better & could survive a very long time before dying, if you like survival type games in general definitely check this out, if you don’t like a challenge, or don’t like indies (for some reason) or just don’t like things that aren’t 3D ultra-graphics & “realistic” then steer clear of the quirky world of Don’t Starve, for the rest, we’ll be trying to survive despite the odds. Its $14.99 USD which is a pretty good deal, I’d recommend getting the bundle with the Reign of Giants for $18.99 USD which will give you a ton of stuff, or get the bundle that comes with a copy of Don’t Starve Together which includes the Reign of Giants DLC & bring a friend along for the ride! Thank you Klei Entertainment for awesome deals on awesome games!

TL/DR; Don’t Starve is a wonderful survival game that doesn’t take itself too seriously but does offer a serious challenge for new comers. It’s got a very unique art style. The game is simple to play & simple to run with the sandbox goal of ‘survive’, it holds no hands & still expects you to succeed, it’s a fun game, & its multiplayer component Don’t Starve Together makes the experience even better with the ability to bring friends along for the suffering. I highly recommend check out both titles, they offer good deals for the single & multiplayer experience, unless you can’t stand the look of the game, or need that “realistic” approach to survival then check out Don’t Starve & Don’t Starve Together!

-Double Thumbs Up from Royial

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game... Wow.
It's awesomely fun.

Characters are in-depth, experiences are all different... Man.

To truly explain why I enjoy this game, here's a little story:

So my friend, I'll just say X, had been playing for, eh, an hour or two. We never got passed day 4 since we suck.
So X dies on day 1. For fun, I decided to continue playing. After 4 rough days of survival, things were going alright...
Until I forgot to build a fire fast enough.

Suddenly, I get smacked three times. Due to my characters low HP, one more smack would destroy me. I quickly equipped a torch. Due to my damage taken at night, I had now lost all sanity.

Things got spooky. Like really spooky.

I somehow survived for three more days with one HP and low sanity... But the last day was when I died on purpose out of pure fear.

As night descended, I quickly built a fire and waited there. Eyes were blinking all over the shadows. I had done this twice, so I didn't think it could get worse. But boy was I was wrong.

Suddenly, creepy music began playing, like something from an old music box. This shadowy hand then extended itself from the shadows, reached over to my campfire, and suddenly my fire went out. Daytime then arrived.

Literally super scared, I found a shadow monster and let it kill me to end the terror.

I'm now super determined to never go insane just because of that. Was... spooky for sure.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I never actually played the original Don't Starve.  I own it and the dlc, but my first experience was with Don't Starve together and, I admit, initially I wasn't sure I'd like the game.

But the graphics style and humour is enchanting and it's insanely addictive when you start playing co-op.  While this will be free for people that have Don't Starve when it gets fully released I really can't stress how happy I was I spent the money and got to play it early.  It plays like a completed game already!

Very worth the purchase, don't hesitate!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are looking for a good multiplayer game.
This is it.

There are a lot of good multiplayer games out there, but one of the main reasons why I love Dont't Starve Together is the simplicity of making a server so you can play with your friends.  All you have to do is click one button (unlike some other games where making a server is a way too complicated process that takes way too much work)

Don't Starve Together is a pretty challenging game(especially with the Reign of Giants DLC). You'll starve. You'll die. A lot. But at least together. (haha I should be punched for that bad joke) This game is creepy but kind of relaxing in its own way.

But of course you should get it because
-It comes with the Reign of Giants DLC
-You can play it with your friends (easy to do too)
-Good Price
-More Fun than Don't Starve
-Beefalo are bae

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a really fun game to play with friends (or alone). It has many things to craft, places to go and monsters to kill. There's one con though, that after a while when you uncover everything, it gets pretty borring (or monotonic). But bigass community workshop comes to help here. Starting with additional crafting items, bushes, trees and monsters, ending with additional prebuilt buildings to discover and fight with (no really, I tried to destroy a wall and I ended up triggering a trap and running away from a huge mechanical monstrosity with 1k or 2k hp).
So if you like survival games that are pretty much a sandbox where everyone still tries to kill you, the game is perfect for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

PROS:
-Mods work seamlessly in multiplayer, it's wonderful and I love them
-Flawless connections to random people, even with my crappy internet
-All the fun of Don't Starve, but multiplayer, 6 player cap but mods allow even more (up to 30!)
-Super easy to have your own servers with friends only, still no connection problems at all! Even I hosted!
-I haven't stopped having fun yet
-99% of people are really friendly
-Pvp is toggleable
-Your world can still be customized in every way just like regular :D
-Super Easy to join friends
CONS (rated from 1-10 on a scale of how critical it is, 1 barely an issue/10 gamebreaking):
-Public servers can have griefers, only one server had this for me, some random a-hole came in and teleported everyone randomly but was quickly banned (3)
-No tooltip to tell you that the means to revive your friends costs 40 hp... I've killed myself twice before realising this (4)
-Haunting doesn't tell you what it does, I accidentally made a werepig thinking I could control a pig (2)
-Dead allies drain sanity REDICULOUSLY fast and revival barely recovers any at all, 2-3 players suffer the most due to inability to reliably obtain spider glands (4)

All in all, I love the challenge, even the heavy insanity drain which is why I give it only a 4 rating out of 10... Others might make an argument that it's too much but there are mods that increase and decrease litterally everything! Don't like certain aspects of the game? CHANGE IT! :D

Definately 100% recommended

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nice survival game, I really like it. Draft of this game is so amazing, graphics, all crafting mechanisms, seasons and items - they are not too OP but worth it. Every world is randomly generated, making each save original (I really like exploring uncharted coasts). This game is every time trying to beat you. It is sometimes funny, but sometimes, it makes me VERY angry. Also a community is super. Almost every 3 days someone creates extraordinary mod - character, item, dish, animation, etc.
For some people, it may be really hard, but that is also the reason, why is it in MULTIPLAYER (if you have got minimally one friend to play with, you will spend much time by playing DST).
I actually find one think, which tricks me off: When you pause the game, playing just one (without any friend), it will NOT be paused, it will be still resumed instead. I also hope, Shipwrecked will be on DST soon (in DS, you can buy R.o.G and SW DLC and switch between them), but in DST is permanently R.o.G. on.
FINAL RESULT sounds: Thanks god (eventually to Klei) for this game.
...Keep on mind, it is still a BETA.
PS: For newbies is every tip important, so I will maybe create a page, where will be everyone able to write anything about this freaking awesome game.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Pros
*Exceedingly high replayability*
*Fun Tim Burton-esque art*
*Multiplayer for suffering in groups*
*Random generation*
*likeable and unique character options*
*Fantastic mod support*
*Cosmetic character items given for playing.*
*Many functional strategies for survival based on your playstyle and preference*
*Difficult*

Cons
*Ever so slight delay between what you see and what is happening. Won't be noticable unless you played Original Don't Starve*
*Mob Hp is scaled up from original Don't Starve which sucks if solo*
*No pause button. would be nice if the host could pause it for everyone to take a pee break without time passing*
*Difficult*

This game is so good I spent my precious time telling you how good it is. I highly recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The gameplay may seem simple, but it's in that simplicity that it holds its charm. What might seem easy as first can quickly begin to seem like an enormous task as the burdens of living in the harsh land snowball onto your character and you can't keep up.

The perma-death feature of the game can make death a traumatizing experience as the character you've so lovingly built up and kept alive for so long has now found it's way to a lonely grave, at the same time it leaves your mind whirring as the cog's and gizmos in your head try to learn from your last play through so that you can survive longer in your next.

The re-playability is huge, there's always something to learn or do better the next time through. On top of that if you decide you'd prefer things a bit different from time to time there's always a huge selection of mods available for the game that offer a wide selection of features. Things as simple as adding in a new playable character based on the Heavy from Team Fortress 2 or changing the rules of how the game work can really spice up the gameplay.

So, really give this game a go if you're into moody, strategic, action packed games that leave you twitching at every movement on the screen. It's my top pick of the year!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Quick Review-
Say pal
date:
you don't look so good. You'd better find your best friend and burn down his stuff before he looks better then you." Thus Don't Starve together was born!


-Detailed breakdown review-
Story:  Don't starve was based on surviving long enough to escape the world you had been put into
recommended: now the enemy has a more familiar face... You can work with your friends to try to survive
hoursPlayed:
or you can burn down their base.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=396194576

Game Play: There are three game modes each with different type of play: Survival
voteText: Endless and Wilderness. Each has a different style of play
helpfulPercent: Survival is the default game play mode and is meant to be more difficult once everyone dies the world resets. In Endless you can play more relaxed and respawn at the portal if you die (unthinkable!)
votesHelpful:
in Wilderness you spawn in random locations in the game.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=506515345

Achievements: None that are steam linked
votesTotal: but you do get bragging rights if you're good at Don't Starve
votesFunny: you can show your friends that if you were sent into a survival situation you would survive by making an axe out of grass and sticks.\n\nPrice: Don't Starve Together's standard price is $19.99
commentsCount: if you already like Don't Starve
column16: this game is a no brainier
column17:
I can't speak high enough of how awesome the Don't Starve series is. If you can't afford it wait for the game to get out of Early Access mode and get it on sale.

Conclusion: What can be said about this game that hasn't already been said? Get this game if you want to play Don't Starve with friends/enemies/people/psychopaths/Wilson's.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=391950755

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a perfect blend of all things survival, mixed in with it's own odd charm and hypnotizing music. This game kept me on my toes as I huddled by the fire in the winter and overheated in the summer. Not to mention the hounds. So. Many. Hounds. I thought this game was excellent when it was just don't starve, but then DST came out, filling and removing the only drawback of not being able to experience it with friends. This game is no doubt challenging, but very rewarding and entertaining nonetheless.

11/10 would feed my friend to hounds again.

This game kept me on my toes as I huddled by the fire in the winter and overheated in the summer. Not to mention the hounds. So. Many. Hounds. I thought this game was excellent when it was just don't starve, but then DST came out, filling and removing the only drawback of not being able to experience it with friends. This game is no doubt challenging, but very rewarding and entertaining nonetheless.

11/10 would feed my friend to hounds again.
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The gameplay may seem simple, but it's in that simplicity that it holds its charm. What might seem easy as first can quickly begin to seem like an enormous task as the burdens of living in the harsh land snowball onto your character and you can't keep up.

The perma-death feature of the game can make death a traumatizing experience as the character you've so lovingly built up and kept alive for so long has now found it's way to a lonely grave, at the same time it leaves your mind whirring as the cog's and gizmos in your head try to learn from your last play through so that you can survive longer in your next.

The re-playability is huge, there's always something to learn or do better the next time through. On top of that if you decide you'd prefer things a bit different from time to time there's always a huge selection of mods available for the game that offer a wide selection of features. Things as simple as adding in a new playable character based on the Heavy from Team Fortress 2 or changing the rules of how the game work can really spice up the gameplay.

So, really give this game a go if you're into moody, strategic, action packed games that leave you twitching at every movement on the screen. It's my top pick of the year!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off: I love that game. It's really great fun. The style, the game play ideas, the humor, it's all there.

Why won't i reccommend it though? Because the community at the moment is bad. Most servers are filled with begging newbies, who can't find food (which isn't all that hard to begin with!). Sooner or later they'll just steal whatever is in your crates and fridge. You have NO WAY to prevent them from taking it besides pretty much carrying everything with you. Which is pretty annoying, as your carrying potential is pretty limited.

When winter comes, most of those players die from freezing. Then they'll bug you to revive them, so they can eat up the rest of your savings... Just abyssmal.

If you only play on a private server with friends, go for it! It's still a great game after all! If you plan to play online with random people, be prepared to be annoyed a lot by incooperative and incompetent players ruining your game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDon't starve for me was a perfect example how you should make a survival game. Most noticeable aspects of this game is it's artstyle which is unique. You need to keep yourself alive by being fed, sane and warm in a crazy world. Also have a light in the dark. This essentially the same game, only with other people and that completely removed a barrier for me and other people who couldn't get in to this game as much as they wanted because it was singleplayer. Frankly, this is the survival game worth getting and most likely to get finished, unlike certain early access survival games on steam.

reviewText: Although not for everyone, Don't Starve Together is a masterful combination of art and gameplay. By adding multiplayer to their largely successful title Don't Starve
date: the original becomes better than ever before.\n\nAs I mentioned, this game is not for everyone. People who enjoy shooter games will not find joy in playing this game. It's a game that requires patience and good habits (checking your food, health, sanity.) As a casual gamer, I find this game to be a blast. It's exiciting and fun, and each time you start it up, it's a brand new experience. I know that I will be playing this game a lot in the near future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't Starve was a gritty grind for survival that left you tired and miserable. With multiplayer, you can now be one of the determining factors in making other players tired and miserable. It's delightful, in a macabre and completely heartless kind of way.

I disguise as a bush, and lash out with a spear at anybody who tries to rustle through my leaves for food. They either die, or are weakened, and subsequently finished off, by the biting cold or a wild dog or the evil omnipresent demon that lurks in the night.

I don't recommend doing that though because you might learn a new swear word or three.

Seriously though, this DLC is siphoning my life away. Top kek.

Review: Fun game, a bit of a challenge, more exiciting and spooky than most survival games and comes with a few characters (NOT all from the original game). reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDon't Starve Together was released into Early-Access on December 15, 2014. I was lucky enough to get a beta key and I played before you could buy it. And I got to say, unless you have friends.... DON'T PLAY THIS VERSION. It seems everything is a little harder like enemies for instance. Then again playing with friends doesn't really help. It probably makes it harder until you get the hang of it. If this so far seems like a negative, it isn't. I actually love this game. The fact that Don't Starve could only add multiplayer to make it better is amazing. This game is great singleplayer, but it gets even better...Together.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is great game to play with friends or for couples! It has a very Tim Burton-esque vibe for those who are a fan of things that are a mix of creepy, cute, and full of depth. My boyfriend, who is a much more frequent gamer than me (I haven't really played many video games in the past 10 years), bought this game for me. It's easy enough that I could get into it, but difficult enough that its about equally challenging for the both of us. I would definitely reccomend this game for friends who want to play a game together, but have different experience levels when it comes to gaming, and definitely to couples who want to play a casual game together. Don't be surprised, however, when this game has you stressing out all over the place, trying to get through the harsh winters and nights. There will always be new things that can kill you. It's still a lot of fun though, as long as you're up for a challenge. Happy camping!

When DST first came out connections were horrible and it was almost impossible to play. However, that is no longer the case and I can now drop a positive review. Pros:
Incredible art style and graphics
Hours of entertainment and infinite replayability (if you're into this genre)
Plenty of spooks as you progress in the game
Really makes your choices matter as one slip up can cost you the game
Multiplayer

Cons:
Very difficult even when you have lots of experience
Finding a good dedicated server that stays up is nearly impossible
Can't be paused (get singleplayer if you want that feature)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nEach day counts. If you don't work together, chances are you won't survive once autumn ends. If you're not ready for each season, you won't last the full cycle. Each season has a different problem of their own, whether it'd be frostbites, wetness, or extreme heat. The availability of mobs also changes with each season, giving some variety of items and mobs to work with. It's best if you've played on your own first to learn where everything is and how they work before playing with others. This is not a game where you can wing it on the fly.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you've played the original Don't Starve and have been aching to play it with your friends, or random people, I highly recommend this game. This game is a lot of fun when it's played with friends because you guys get to decide on what type of adventure you guys want to get yourselves into because you can edit the world to your liking. Whether it be a world with scarce resources, monster-filled environments, or with just plain, set-to-default settings, it's still very fun! As a veteran player, I really like jumping into random games people host because I like to observe" what the other veterans do (like hunting Koalefants/Tallbirds for their meats) and what the new players are trying to do (like killing five spiders
date: two of which are Spider Warriors
voteText: I have to admit
helpfulPercent: is very entertaining the majority of the time. There are some times
votesHelpful: ESPECIALLY when the Winter season comes
votesTotal: where you just wish everyone that joined the game you're in knows what they're doing
votesFunny: or just able to "pull their weight
commentsCount:
because of scarce resources (many people make all sorts of personal tools and gear without gathering the materials themselves) and constantly dwindling food supplies (too many mouths to feed and not enough hunters). However, when your whole team DOES manage to make it past the first winter season, it's a very satisfying accomplishment.

If all of what I previously said doesn't sound very appealing to you, then don't bother with the game. Frankly, if you like making a base JUST for YOURSELF, not liking the idea of being with other players, or just being antisocial in general, then you really wouldn't like the multiplayer addition to Don't Starve; this game is meant to be played with other people and working TOGETHER with said people (hence the emphasis on TOGETHER for DST's teaser), so you're seriously better off playing vanilla if you're just going to be antisocial in a social game. I don't want to sound mean, but it's the truth (at least it is for me).

Even though the game is still in its Beta phase, it's very playable; the devs have done a great job so far and the updates just keep rolling in with fixes. Get it if you really want it, but if you can wait, then I recommend waiting for its official multiplayer release (around summer), of which is included (I THINK) in the original Don't Starve.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a huge fan of this game, I wasn't expecting a multiplayer expansion to this. But it happened, so cheese.

But, seriously, though, I would wait for this to be out of Early Access, but having the patience of a 5 year old, I could'nt wait any more. Not to mention, some of my other friends wanted a copy of this game too, so... :3

Anywho, the gameplay, It's Don't Starve with more people on. What do you expect? Meing there's either gonna be friendly co-op, or just being a ♥♥♥♥ to everyone. The goal here is to surivive as many days as possible with other players/friends. To me, co-op is the most strongest element in this game. Sure, you can surivive by yourself, but where's the fun in that? That, and you'll get kicked.... At random.

But, I've litterally played this game ALL DAY. And after that, my eyes kinda hurt. But, it was the best eye pain ever to get.

10/10; Still better than Minecraft.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, I would like to thank Kirito - a friend of mine who gave me a key to this game. The amount of fun I'm having with this game is enormous, it takes coorporative survival to a whole new level. Don't Starve is an amazing game already, but turning it into an experience you can share has to be the greatest Idea sinse RoG.

This just takes you through so many thrilling moments. From following Koelefant tracks in the cold *** winter to trying to get a Tallbird egg - while the other one distracts the herd. The only thing this lacks is the updates ahead, I absolutely recommend this game! After all, what's the fun in starving alone?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, here I am. I would have NEVER thought that I would be writing a review for a multiplayer Don't Starve game. After months, possibly years of Klei telling us fans that there would be no multiplayer in Don't Starve. At the time, I believed them. Am I glad that this is a thing? Yes. Of course. Playing this game with my friends in incredible. I didn't think that the core elements of Don't Starve would work as a multiplayer game, but with *minor* tweaking, they do. For the remainder of this review, please indulge yourself with a story.

Day #1: Finding food, and running around like an idiot

Day #2: Find a good place for a base

Day #3: Completly ignore that good place and build our base in a much worse place

Day#4: We find beefalo, that's pretty much it

Day#5: My friend dies from a tentacle

Day#6: I make a telltale heart and revive her

Day#7: Hounds attack

Day#8: We attack some beefalo with Abigale, it works out

*SKIPPING ALOT OF STUFF*

Day#25: My friend decides to go into the winter wilderness and dies from a hound attack. I kill the hounds, but can't revieve her

Night of Day#25: I give up on life and run into the darkness, accepting death

10/10 would give up on life again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't Starve Together, the recent co-op add-on by Tim Burt-, I mean Klei Entertainment, steps up the already exciting single player original. Even in Early Access, you can tell that the transition from SP to MP is nearly flawless. The game plays just as well, and even though things like caves and various events aren't included yet, it's just as fun.

The only downside to the game is the people who seem to take a liking to ruining your world. I.E., a person playing as Willow has to be watched carefully, lest he/she burn your berry bushes, forests and various other items down before you even notice it.

That however, brings me to my favorite part; the mods. DST has one of the most closely-knitted mod community of any game I currently own, including a mod that makes it difficult for Willow players to light things on fire. Other mods include adding additional items, characters, etc. My current favorite is Renewable World"
date: where every item in the game respawns at some point
recommended: so you never exhaust a map of it's resources. The best part is that you can set the speed at which they respawn
hoursPlayed: so you can tailor it to your own preferences. They're all genuinely exciting
voteText: and can enhance your DST experience an endless amount of times over.\n\nI highly recommend this game for anyone who's interested in a quirky
helpfulPercent: detailed survival experience. It's most definitely a new and exciting take on one of the most popular game genres currently out there."
votesHelpful: January 26, 2015
votesTotal: true

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a huge fan of this game, I wasn't expecting a multiplayer expansion to this. But it happened, so cheese.

But, seriously, though, I would wait for this to be out of Early Access, but having the patience of a 5 year old, I could'nt wait any more. Not to mention, some of my other friends wanted a copy of this game too, so... :3

Anywho, the gameplay, It's Don't Starve with more people on. What do you expect? Meing there's either gonna be friendly co-op, or just being a ♥♥♥♥ to everyone. The goal here is to surivive as many days as possible with other players/friends. To me, co-op is the most strongest element in this game. Sure, you can surivive by yourself, but where's the fun in that? That, and you'll get kicked.... At random.

But, I've litterally played this game ALL DAY. And after that, my eyes kinda hurt. But, it was the best eye pain ever to get.

10/10; Still better than Minecraft.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a charming and witty game for sure, and if you have friends, it's even better. It takes survival and resource gathering to a new level, and there are a variety of ways one can go about playing this game. Add that with the large number of high quality mods in the Steam Workshop, there are many tweaks and changes one can do to make every newly generated world unique.

With Cave Content and skin customization on the horizon, this game will definitely excel to new heights and become an even better game than it is now.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is the greatest example of the few times where you can take an amazing idea and make it even better! I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys Don't Starve or even people that just like good survival games. If I were to have any complaints, it would only be that the living conditions during the Summer Season ingame is a tad too harsh (EX: losing 1 HP per second when not in shade...). Overall, A very enjoyable game and good for anyone looking for fun times.
